Collin K. Berke, Ph.D. is a media research analyst in public media. Professionally, he uses data and media/marketing research methods to answer questions on how to best reach and engage audiences--towards the goal of enriching lives and engaging minds with public media content and services. He is interested in the use and development of open-source statistical software (i.e. [`Rstats`](https://www.r-project.org/){target="_blank"}) to achieve this goal, and developing a broader understanding the role it can play in media, digital, and marketing analytics. 

Collin also serves as an adjunct instructor for the [University of Nebraska-Lincoln](https://www.unl.edu/){target="_blank"} and [Southeast Community College](https://www.southeast.edu/){target="_blank"}, where he teaches courses in sports data visualization and analysis and communication specific courses. He holds a M.A. in Communication Studies from the [The University of South Dakota](https://www.usd.edu/){target="_blank"} and a Ph.D. in Media and Communication from [Texas Tech University](http://www.ttu.edu/){target="_blank"}. He has also published and contributed to the publication of several academic journal articles. 

Collin is a self-proclaimed news, sports, and podcast junkie. He really enjoys listening to [NPR](https://www.npr.org/){target="_blank} and watching college football and baseball. At times, he will write blog posts on topics he finds interesting in these areas.
